00029 #ifndef TCPIPREC_H_
00030 #define TCPIPREC_H_

00032 #include "inxout.h"

00036 class   tcpiprec:       public inxout
00037 {
00038   typedef       inxout  baseclass;
00039 public:
00040   tcpiprec(void): evtImAck(this, keyImAck), 
00041                   evtTick(this, keyTick),
00042                   evtDelAck(this, keyDelAck), 
00043                   evtOutput(this, keyOutput),
00044                   evtProcq(this, keyProcq),
00045                   evtKeepAlive(this, keyKeepAlive)
00046   {
00047     ptrTcpSend = NULL;          
00048     sockstate = ContSend;               
00049     reseq_head = NULL;
00050   }
00051   ~tcpiprec();
00052   int act(void);
00053   void resetStat(void);
00054   int   max_win;        // window high water mark
00055   int   wnd;            // current window size
00056   double        proctim_secs;   // time for processing a segment, seconds
00057   double        ackdel_secs;    // delay for send a delayed ACK, seconds                
00058   int   ph_efOn;                // Phase effects ON/OFF
00059   double        iackdel_secs;   // delay for send an immediate ACK, seconds
00060   double  keepalive_secs;        // Keep-Alive in Seconds
00061   int   ack_seq;        // sequence number of ACK packetnxt
00062   int   nxt;            // next receive sequence number
00063   int   adv;            // highest advertised sequence number + 1
00064   int   connected;      // TRUE: we are connected to a TCP sender
00065   int     needImAck;    // Flag if an immediate ACK will be generated
00066   // also shows that the timer evtImAck is registered
00067   int   needDelAck;     // Flag if a delayed ACK will be generated
00068   // also shows that the timer evtDelAck is registered
00069   int   tcp_header_len; // length of TCP header
00070   int   ip_header_len;  // length of IP header
00071   int   ts_option_len;  // length of Timestamp Options
00072   
00073   int   ts_recent;      // copy of the most-recent valid timestamp
00074   int   last_ack;       // value of byte for echo of timestamp
00075   rec_typ       sockstate;      // state of this object (StopSend or ContSend) for output to user
00076   int   activeOutput;   // event evtOutput is registered -> output is in progress
00077   tim_typ       lastPackStamp;  // PackStamp field of last received segment for echo to sender
00078   int   tcp_now;        // 500msec timer
00079   
00080   // statistics
00081   int   arrived_segments;       // # of arrived segments
00082   int   arrived_bytes;          // # of arrived bytes
00083   int   arrived_valid_bytes;    // # of valid arrived bytes
00084   int   user_packets;           // # of successful transmitted segments to user
00085   int   user_bytes;             // # of successful transmitted bytes to user
00086   int   procq_max_len;          // maximum length of processing queue
00087   int   reseq_max_len;          // maximum length of resequencing queue
00088   int   reseq_len;              // length of resequencing queue
00089   int   out_of_order_segments;  // # of arrived out-of-order segments
00090   int   out_of_order_bytes;     // # of arrived out-of-order bytes
00091   int   ack_cnt;                // # of ACKs sent
00092   
00093   int   tp_bytes;               // # of successful transmitted bytes to user (used in throughput calc)
00094   
00095   int   SDU_delay;              // delay of current SDU
00096   double        SDU_delay_mean;         // mean delay of SDUs
00097   int   SDU_cnt;                // counter for delay statistic calculation
00098   int   PDU_delay;              // delay of current PDU
00099   double        PDU_delay_mean;         // mean delay of PDUs
00100   int   PDU_cnt;                // counter for delay statistic calculation
00101

00115     keyImAck = 1,

00118     keyOutput = 4,
00119     keyProcq = 5,
00120     keyKeepAlive = 6

00153   int   MTU;            // maximum transmission unit
00154   
00155   tim_typ       ack_delay;      // delay for send a delayed ACK, slots
00156         
00157   
00158   tim_typ       proc_time;      // time for processing a segment, slots
00159   
00160   tim_typ       iack_delay;     // delay for immediate ACKs; !!! needed to avoid synchronisation effects
00161                                 // because of copy strategy on socket interface with Start-Stop-Protocol
00162   
00163   tcpipFrame    *reseq_head;    // queue of out-of-order packets waiting to be processed
00164   
00165   uqueue        procq;          // queue of incoming packets waiting to be processed
00166   uqueue        outputq;        // queue of packets waiting to be read by user process
00167   
00168   event evtImAck;       // event for immediate ACK
00169   event evtTick;        // event for slow timer (default 500msec)
00170   event evtDelAck;      // event for fast timer (default 200msec for delayed ACK)
00171   event evtOutput;      // event for processing the output queue
00172   event evtProcq;       // event to activate processing queue
00173   event evtKeepAlive;   // event for Keep Alive Timer
00174 };
